formattedAddress: 77 Walker St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 77 Walker St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Craft cocktails & diverse nightly live music in a subterranean, industrial-chic speakeasy.

originalText.text: Loved my experience here! We went pretty early and were able to snag 2 spots at the bar without having a reservation - usually it is expected for you to make a reservation because there is high demand here. It is pretty hard to spot the entrance - the only indication is a little "ST" on the glass door and the host standing at the door. The drinks were amazing, and we didn't even order from the menu! We just asked the bartender to make us something based on our regular drinks, my friend even asked for a drink based on a FEELING, and they were able to nail it. Live jazz starts around 10pm, I believe. The music was great and the place is so small it feels really intimate. Definitely recommend for a fun but relaxed evening plan

originalText.text: Very difficult to get a weekend reservation and when we actually got one they did not have a table for us when we arrived. Sat at the bar instead - which is better in some ways so you are not limited by time, and we got to see the band.  Would be nice if they added a set so music started prior to 10 pm on weekends. Bartender was nice but a rude waitress who did not seem to get along well with the other staff,  pushed / elbowed us as we were standing up to get our coats to leave as we were in her way and she didn’t have patience to say excuse me.  Overall didn’t feel as high end as it should for the price and the difficulty getting reservations.

originalText.text: Perfect atmosphere for a date! Literally anyone will fall in love with you for choosing this location. Late night jazz is like a cherry on top. Dark vibes makes it more cozy and comfortable.

text.text: Perfect atmosphere for a date! Literally anyone will fall in love with you for choosing this location. Late night jazz is like a cherry on top. Dark vibes makes it more cozy and comfortable.

originalText.text: We were able to walk in here around 8:30 on a Friday evening. The host greeted us at the street level door, and guided us on a long descent down several staircases to the space underground. We sat at the bar, and enjoyed a few drinks of their cocktail list. The space is intimate, and has a very exclusive, clubby feel. We weren’t able to stay long enough for the live music, but will be back on an evening when we’re able to enjoy that as well.

originalText.text: Cocktails were just off… I got a citrus one with ginger and it was like drinking straight ginger shots in the morning, couldn’t finish. My boyfriend ordered a burbon one and it was not what indicated in the menu. They were also out of Mezcal which is very odd for a bar in NYC… service was really slow, took us 25 min to get drinks and over 15 to get my card back after paying. It s sad because the atmosphere and music were great
